intro: Diasperus cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese star anise, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic fruits that resemble star anise. The plant produces yellowish flowers and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to star anise. The botanical features of Diasperus cochinchinensis make it valuable for both culinary and medicinal purposes.
